body:
Terrain improvements are changes to a hex that improve the land for your kingdom's use, such as cultivating fields, digging mines, and clearing forests for lumber. The following list describes common improvements. An improvement marked with an asterisk (*) can share the same hex as other improvements.

Some terrain improvements affect a settlement's Defense, which is used in the mass combat rules.
name: Terrain Improvements
url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements

sections.body: This indicates what kind of hex you can build this terrain improvement in.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body:
This line states the effect the terrain improvement has on that hex (or in some cases, your entire kingdom).

If an improvement says you can upgrade it into another improvement, you can do so by paying the cost difference between the two improvements. When the upgrade is complete, you lose the benefit of the old improvement but gain the benefit of the new improvement.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: This line gives the cost in BP to build the terrain improvement.
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: An Aqueduct brings water from alpine lakes and rivers to lowland cities where water is scarce or insufficient for the local populace. A finished series of Aqueduct hexes must connect to a hill or mountain hex (with a river or lake) on one end and a settlement on the other end; otherwise, you do not gain its benefit.
sections.name: Aqueduct*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Aqueduct*

sections.body: One end must be hill or mountain hex; can pass through any type of hex.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Loyalty+1, Stability +1, allows settlement to build water-dependent buildings.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: As a Road, except the cost is not doubled for hexes with rivers (see the Terrain and Terrain Improvements table).
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A Bridge allows your Road hexes to cross rivers.
sections.name: Bridge*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Bridge*

sections.body: When you build a Road in a hex that contains a river, the doubled coast of the Road includes the cost of bridges needed to cross the river. You don't need to build a Bridge as a separate unit; it's listed here for reference only.
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A Canal is an artificial waterway that allows barge traffic to haul heavy commodities.
sections.name: Canal*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Canal*

sections.body: Desert, hill, or plain.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Settlements in a hex with a Canal treat the hex as if it had a river.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: Twice the cost of a Road (see the Terrain and Terrain Improvements table).
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A Farm helps feed your kingdom.
sections.name: Farm*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Farm*

sections.body: Desert (requires canal, coastline, or river), hill, or plain.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Consumption decreases by 2 BP.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: See the Terrain and Terrain Improvements table.
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A Fishery is like a Farm, except it provides abundant fish rather than planted crops.
sections.name: Fishery*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Fishery*

sections.body: Coastline, water, river, or marsh.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Consumption decreases by 1 BP.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: A Fort is a walled encampment for military forces outside a settlement. You can upgrade a Watchtower to a Fort (Unrest decreases when you do so, just as if you had built the Fort from scratch).
sections.name: Fort*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Fort*

sections.body: Any land.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Stability +2, Defense +4, increase Consumption by 1 BP; Unrest decreases by 1 when completed. If this hex becomes a settlement, this improvement counts as one Barracks and one Stables building.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: A highway is a paved and well-maintained version of a Road. You may upgrade a Road into a Highway. You must have a kingdom of Size 26 or greater to build a Highway.
sections.name: Highway*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Highway*

sections.body: Any hex with a Road.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Economy +1 for every 4 hexes of Highway, Stability +1 for every 8 hexes of Highway; improves overland travel speed.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: Twice the cost of a Road (see the Terrain and Terrain Improvements table).
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A Mine extracts metal, coal, salt, or other useful materials from the earth.
sections.name: Mine
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Mine

sections.body: Cavern, desert, hill, or mountain.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Economy +1, earn +1 BP per turn when collecting taxes during the Income phase.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: A Quarry extracts workable stone from the ground.
sections.name: Quarry
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Quarry

sections.body: Cavern, hill, or mountain.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Stability +1, earn +1 BP per turn when collecting taxes during the Income phase.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: A Road speeds travel through your kingdom and promotes trade. You can upgrade a Road to a Highway.
sections.name: Road*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Road*

sections.body: Any land.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Economy +1 for every 4 hexes of Road, Stability +1 for every 8 hexes of Road; improves overland travel speed.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: See the Road column of the Terrain and Terrain Improvements table.
sections.name: Cost

sections.body: A sawmill centralizes the activities of loggers and turns trees into lumber for use in building and crafting.
sections.name: Sawmill
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Sawmill

sections.body: Forest or jungle.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Stability +1, earn +1 BP per turn when collecting taxes during the Income phase.
sections.name: Effect

sections.body: A Watchtower flies your flag, is a safe place for your patrols, and establishes your power on the frontier. A Watchtower cannot share a hex with a Fort or another Watchtower.
sections.name: Watchtower*
sections.url: pfsrd://Ultimate Campaign/Rules/Kingdoms And War/Kingdom Turn Sequence/Terrain Improvements/Watchtower*

sections.body: Any land.
sections.name: Terrain

sections.body: Stability +1, Defense +2; Unrest decreases by 1 when completed. If this hex becomes a settlement, this improvement counts as a Watchtower building.
sections.name: Effect
